resources.string: Some skills do NOT have sufficient permissions.
Are you sure you want to delete %s\?
Could not delete. Check whether this item is being used.
Prevented saving data with invalid field(s). Please recheck your choices / inputs.
Failed to save data. Please check if there is naming clash.
IOException encountered. Perhaps storage is full?
To set Dynamics, you need to select a valid Profile and a valid trigger (e.g. Event).
Grant Easer <%s> permission for this to work.
Easer just recorded an error. See the "error" subdirectory of log directory.

Ease your life by automating routine actions on your device(s). 
Chain different events and let their corresponding actions performed. No longer need to keep them in mind! 
This app was inspired by CyanogenMod's 'profile' mechanism and IFTTT. The original intuition was to automatically change the profile on certain time or specific Wi-Fi connections, and it was expanded for more general use then. 
Reminder: Easer is still in development. It may contain bugs and the UI definitely needs to be improved. Have a look in TODO.en.md (or TODO.md if you can read Chinese) on the repo to help out.

This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.\n This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.\n You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program. If not, see https://www.gnu.org/licenses/
Starts Easer in the background when the device is turned on.
Show welcome message when opening app
Logs to external storage devices (/sdcard/logger) to aid bug reports. \nChanges take effect at next app start.
Use root permission for specific functions (skills) to help resolve compatibility issues on some devices.
Timeframe in seconds to treat two occurrences as one event.
Your number is too high, or not a positive whole number.
Turn on or off certain skills
Export all events and profiles to SD card. \nThe current time as of saving will be used as filename.
Import all events and profiles from a ZIP file. \nExisting events and profiles with same name will be replaced.
Convert all data to the recommended format
Show a notification in the notification bar.
Make it harder to for the system to kill the service. A notification will be shown. Can not be turned off on Android 8+ because of a system requirement.
This device can not run this skill.
Could not convert the data. Please see the log for details.

Welcome. 
 
Here is some basic info to read before using Easer. 
 
More involved topics covered in the project wiki FAQ.

Easer contains several modules providing different functions. Turn them on or off in Settings. 
 
The corresponding permissions (for every active module) should be granted before use. 
 
 
(Everything is on by default.)

Scripts are structured as trees, by choosing the relevant parent. 
 
In every branch, AND logic is performed. 
Between branches, OR logic is performed. 
 
 
Extending trees to graphs is planned, but not currently implemented.

Privacy is important! 
 
Easer is free software (open-source software), ensuring everyone use, study, change and share it. 
 
YOU own every piece of your data. Everything lives on your device, including the logs.
Select \"Convert Data\" in the settings to update your data to the new format, for compatibility.
Tree view of Scripts will be removed in v0.8. Pivot provides a better view towards that.
This file doesn\'t seem to be valid. Make sure to import a file exported by Easer.

\"Scripts\" are the logic containers. Connect an event or a condition with a profile in a script, so that Easer knows to load/execute that profile when the event occurs, or the condition is met. \nThere are also more advanced functions, e.g. reversed events. \nPlease refer to the document for more info.
\"Events\" represent short-time (instant) occurrences on your device, or remotely. \nFor example, receiving a notification, or an NFC tag is scanned. \nPlease refer to the document for more info.

\"Condition\" represents a long-lasting (but usually not forever) condition on your device or remotely. \nFor example, upon connection Wi-Fi, or as the screen turns off. \nPlease refer to the document for more info.
\"Profile\" is a set of operations. Each operation represents a particular type of action. \nFor example, turn on Bluetooth, or send an SMS. \nPlease refer to the document for more info.
This Easer profile uses a method that is not officially supported by Android. It might not work on all devices.
